item.title: Measures of Dispersion
item.description: Data Standard Deviation Purpose Equations Calculation Example Interpretation Data set.seed(123) norm_vec <- rnorm(1000) library(tidyverse) norm_df <- tibble(val = norm_vec) ggplot(norm_df, aes(x = val)) + geom_density(fill = "pink", color = NA, alpha = 0.5) + geom_vline(aes(xintercept = mean(val)), color = "darkgreen") + geom_text(aes(x = mean(val), y = 0.5, label = "mean"), size = 7, family = "serif") + geom_vline(aes(xintercept = mean(val) + sd(val)), color = "darkblue") + geom_text(aes(x = mean(val) + sd(val), y = 0.

item.title: Thoughts on Teaching R and Yet Another Tidyverse Intro
item.description:
Context Reflection Resources Up Front tibble %>% “Tidy” Data select() columns filter() Rows mutate() Columns arrange() Rows group_by() for Grouped Data summarize() Image credit to R Memes for Statistical Fiends
Considering this is a blog post, I’m going to get all bloggy here before jumping into the code. Context I recently had the opportunity to teach some R coding to colleagues and classmates in a series of workshops.
